Fertility rate is a projection of the average number of children born to each woman in her lifetime.
content.question: Which of the following best describes the trend in Western Europe from 1960 to 2000 ?

choices.label: Fertility rates dropped steadily, with a slight rebound from 1990 to 2000.
Fertility rates remained steady from 1960 to 1980, then dropped sharply.
Fertility rates increased slightly from 1960 to 1990, then dropped sharply.
Fertility rates declined steadily throughout the period 1960 to 2000.

content.answer: Fertility rates dropped steadily, with a slight rebound from 1990 to 2000.

topic.text: 9.14: 20th- and 21st-Century Culture, Arts, and Demographic Trends

skill.text: Skill 5.A: Identify patterns among or connections between historical developments and processes.
